tests.setup: Log in. Check the current cookies in browser. There should be two and only two cookies, csrftoken and sessionid. You may also omit some fields username/password in the request body.
tests.javascript: fetch('/login_async', postRequestContent({ username: '<random/correct username>', password: '<random/correct password>' })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response));
tests.expected: Response 400, console notification that you are already logged in. There should still remain the two cookies with the same name.

tests.setup: Log out. Check the current cookies in browser. There should be only one cookie, the csrftoken. Omit either one or both fields username/password in the post request body.
tests.javascript: fetch('/login_async', postRequestContent({ username: '<random/correct username>', password: '<random/correct password>' })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response));
tests.expected: Response 400, console notification that either username or password is missing. There should still remain the one csrftoken cookie.

tests.setup: Log out. Check the current cookies in browser. There should be only one cookie, the csrftoken.
tests.javascript: fetch('/login_async', postRequestContent({ username: '<wrong username>', password: '<wrong password>' })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response));
tests.expected: Response 400, console notification that wrong login credentials are provided. There should still remain the one csrftoken cookie.

tests.setup: Log out. Check the current cookies in browser. There should be only one cookie, the csrftoken. After running the javascript code, refresh the page.
tests.javascript: fetch('/login_async', postRequestContent({ username: '<correct username>', password: '<correct password>' })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response));
tests.expected: Response 200, console notification that you are logged in. A new cookie sessionid is added, and csrftoken cookie remains. After refreshing, you are redirected to the home page.

tests.javascript: fetch('/register_async', postRequestContent({ name: '<name>', username: '<username>', password: '<password>' })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response))
tests.expected: Response 400, console notification that you are already logged in.

tests.setup: Log out. Check the current cookies in browser. There should only be one cookie, the csrftoken. Omit at least one field in the request body.
tests.javascript: fetch('/register_async', postRequestContent({ name: '<name>', username: '<username>', password: '<password>' })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response))
tests.expected: Response 400, console notification that request body is missing one of the values. There should still remain only one cookie, the csrftoken.

tests.setup: Log out. Check the current cookies in browser. There should only be one cookie, the csrftoken.
tests.javascript: fetch('/register_async', postRequestContent({ name: '<name>', username: '<a username already in existence>', password: '<password>' })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response))
tests.expected: Response 200, console notification that username is already taken. There should still remain only one cookie, the csrftoken.

tests.setup: Log out. Check the current cookies in browser. There should be only one cookie, the csrftoken. Make the value corresponding to at least one field an empty string.
tests.javascript: fetch('/register_async', postRequestContent({ name: '<name>', username: '<username>', password: '<password>' })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response))
tests.expected: Response 200, console notification that one of the fields is empty. There should still remain only one cookie, the csrftoken.

tests.setup: Log out. Check the current cookies in browser. There should be only one cookie, the csrftoken.
tests.javascript: fetch('/register_async', postRequestContent({ name: '<name>', username: '<a username not already in existence>', password: '<password>' })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response))
tests.expected: Response 200, console notification that account is already created. There should still remain the csrftoken cookie, and a new sessionid cookie is added. Reloading the page will redirect the user to the home page.

tests.setup: Log in. Check the current cookies in browser. There should be two cookies, the csrftoken and the sessionid.
tests.expected: Response 200, console notification that you are logged out. The cookie sessionid should disappear.
